answers.answer: I wouldn't diet just yet, I'd slow down and eat healthier. Of you want to do a little exercise, walk, but don't overdue it. If you feel any pain.....STOP IMMEDIATELY!  Hope it helps hun, good luck! :)

Missjune, if u exercised before, you should be ok to go back to it. I was lifting b4 and after the morning sickness nicked off I'm back in the gym. Just doing half weights that I was. I'm exercising heaps, 3-4 times a week for an hour, but still not a quarter of what I used to do and I'm huge. I was 68kg and 165cm b4. Now at 17 weeks I'm 78. Just try and keep your fitness up so that it comes off easily afterwards. GL.
You are not overweight ! Just eat healthy and was and post baby can do a little more. That's my plan and im alot more than u :)

Thank you so much I was very fit before and I worked out every other day and then morning sickness kicked in ewwww and after the morning sickness ended I started working out again and than I began to spot and was put on bedrest for about a month and after all of that they tell me I'm over weight! This is crazy... But thank you for the advice!

People will say no because they think diet means not eating. Yes you can diet as in change your diet. Eat healthier. Eat lots of veggies, fruit and lean proteins like chicken and fish. Try to limit your fat foods and carbs(bread,tortillas,rice,pasta, etc..), drink only water(water,fruit infused water, non caffeinated tea) and go on daily walks 30 minutes a day.

If you've had issues with spotting, I'd talk to your doctor before trying an exercise routine. If you're worried about your diet, see if your doc can get you a referral to a dietician--they'll walk you through healthy food choices so you don't have to worry about eating too little.
Eat healthy and walk every day at least 25 min at day

Miss June, I'd be very careful about the exercise if you've already had a scare. Id rather get fat and get gestational diabetes than risk the bun in the oven. See if you feel good in swimming pool. Gently Walk or swim some laps and see how u go. One pang of pain and I'd pull up if I was you. Good luck.

Sometimes the body has a way of balancing out things like this when you are pregnant. I know a few women, myself included that were slightly over weight when they got pregnant. Instead of gaining weight right away we all actually lost some or stayed about the same. As our pregnancies progressed we didn't gain as much as some women, but our babies grew perfect.I believe your biggest concern should be eating healthy and in reasonable moderation. Light exercise such as brisk walks should be fine, unless otherwise noted by your doc. I wouldn't go starting a regime of jumping jax and crunches if you weren't doing these thing prior to being pregnant. You can speak with your doc about your concerns and im sure he can help. he May even put ylu in touch with a nutritionist. I jab heard moms that had gestational diabetes say the diet they were put on helped them lose weight. Dont stress yourself and just focus on your health. And dont be down about it! Good luck :)

question: I was told I am 25 pounds overweight I Was 141 when I got pregnant I am now 5 months pregnant and I weigh 171 is it okay to diet? and if it's not okay then why do they tell me that but what difference does it make because there's nothing I can do except slowdown and eat in moderation now.
title: over weight?
